div.p: We learn, not for school but for life! * Grades 6-12 * Public Charter School Education

li.a: Apply to Great Bay Charter School
Friends of Great Bay Charter School

div.p: What is Project-based Learning? How often have we experienced school as “information giving” in traditional classroom settings? In this...

What Makes Great Bay Charter School Unique? The Great Bay Charter School blends differentiated classroom instructional strategies and a project-based approach to instruction and other means to extend learning beyond the wall of the classroom. Students work individually and collaboratively to show the products of their learning. Our school emphasizes writing...

div.h2: Apply to Great Bay Charter School

div.p: Applying to Great Bay Charter School Student enrollment for the fall is currently on a space-available basis depending on the grade. Please contact...

h1.span: Welcome to Great Bay Charter School

p.span: Please explore our site and feel free to call us at (603) 775-8638 for more information.

br.span: The Great Bay Charter School (GBCS), formally known as the Great Bay eLearning Charter School (GBeCS), is a public chartered school authorized by the New Hampshire Board of Education. Approved in 2004, we opened our doors to ninth grade students in January 2005 and have evolved to serve students in grades 6-12 today.

p.span: Our program emphasizes project-based learning in a purposefully designed smaller learning community. Our community is broken into two grade span groups with our 6th-8th grade Lower School and 9th-12th grade Upper School. Each student works closely with a faculty advisor and meets daily with their advisory group.

Our school emphasizes avenues for personalization of learning through development of goals-based Personalized Learning Plans (PLPs). Each student leads a PLP conference with his/her team twice per year.

Students are provided with a significant degree of flexibility to adapt projects to their learning styles, but are expected to be engaged, committed learners. Students from any New Hampshire community are eligible to apply and the application process is designed so that both student/family and school can get to know each other and begin to develop a potential partnership.
